"I could disable Nightlight's weapondry, a small energy field might
prevent the vork from leaving Nightlight." Kenzo suggested.

--- In nbwrpg@yahoogroups.com, "airly2000" <airly2002@h...> wrote:
> Rodimus:
> 
> "I'm afraid that the Vork can't be eliminate"said gloomy the Maximal 
> Boss"Let me explain it... Their presence were reported in first 
> BeastWars"
> 
> Rodimus told Kenzo all he knew about them, how Optimus Primal found 
> them and how Maximals avoided the destruction of earth and how they 
> create TigerHawk and use him to destroy Pred's base...
> 
> "This is all that we knows about them... they consider this planet 
> as their lab..." and looking to the sleepping Nighlight"If their are 
> involved... I guess that the vork presence while Unicron it's around 
> here isn't a coincidence... Perhaps we should better wait until 
> she's awake and interrgate her... How can we interrogate her without 
> let her destroy all the base???"
> 
> 
> 
> 
> 
> 
> 
> --- In nbwrpg@yahoogroups.com, "CatMaster o" <CatMastero@y...> wrote:
> > --- In nbwrpg@yahoogroups.com, "airly2000" <airly2002@h...> wrote:
> > > Rodimus:
> > > 
> > > "What do you suggest?" said gloomy Rodimus while he watched 
> > > Nighlight-Sedna sleep
> > > 
> > "She'll need to be carefully examined for how exactly this creature
> > got in her, it might even require spark surgery, a very dangerous
> > procedure," Kenzo continued.  "And even if we do get it out it 
> might
> > try to acquire a new host if not eliminated fast enough.  The data 
> we
> > have of the Vork is extremely limited complicating things even 
> more."
